newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Pioneer may sell Ampol stake - paper.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Pioneer may sell Ampol stake - paper.

text.p: Building products and energy group Pioneer International Ltd is considering selling its 50 percent stake in Australia's largest petroleum refiner Ampol because of concerns over its profitability, The Sydney Morning Herald newspaper reported on Wednesday.

"The Herald understands Pioneer has engaged external consultants for advice on the possible sale of its half share in Ampol, the refiner formed from last year's A$3 billion merger with Caltex Australia Ltd," the newspaper said.

"Industry sources said possibilities for the disposal of Ampol included sale through a float, a backdoor listing into Caltex, sale to Caltex's U.S. parent, Caltex Petroleum Corp, and a trade sale to another party," the newspaper said.
Caltex Petroleum Corp is owned 50 percent each by Texaco Inc and Chevron Corp.
Pioneer chief executive John Schubert said last Friday he saw weak petroleum refiner margins at Ampol over the next two years because of the start-up of new refineries in Asia recently.

Caltex also said on Friday that Ampol had traded below expectations in the third quarter of calendar 1996 and that this would mean Caltex's second half year profitabilty would be below that of the first half year.
Pioneer shares closed down five cents at A$3.35 on Tuesday while Caltex's shares closed down 11 cents at A$4.15.
